newsitem.title: JAPAN: Yamaichi shares down on newspaper report.
newsitem.headline: Yamaichi shares down on newspaper report.

text.p: Shares of Yamaichi Securities Co Ltd, one of Japan's "Big Four" securities houses, dipped on Friday morning after a newspaper report saying it was involved in a irregular stock deal. It was ask-only at the opening.
Yamaichi said it could not confirm whether it made such a deal, and added that it could not comment further.
The sales were triggered after the daily Sankei Shimbun reported that Yamaichi had engaged in a "tobashi" deal, where a brokerage hides a client's losses, traders said.
At 0056 GMT, the shares price was down 14 yen at 321, making it the fourth largest percentage loser on the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
"Tobashi" deals may violate Japan's securities law.
